Should the remittance be refunded based on an unsatisfactory participation process, the buyer shall be responsible for any refund cost, and the disqualification to participate in the project. The successful participation of a single buyer does not mean that a project is fully purchased.
In regards to the participation process and regulations, a detailed Sales and Lease Back Contract and supporting contractual agreements will be provided to successful buyers.

The specific details of each project will be described on the Project Page, but it is important that you understand the following general risks about purchasing solar panels via our Website:

Loss of asset and rental income: if a Solar farm project performs poorly or fails altogether, you may lose part or all of your purchase amount and you may not receive the rental income described on the Project Page. You should not purchase with more money than you can afford to lose. Participation of capital in any project can fail, so it is important to ensure that you do not spend more money than you can afford to lose. This applies to all purchases you make, whether via our Website or via other online platforms.

Illiquidity: the solar panels that you purchase are transferable, but there is very unlikely to be a secondary market. The solar panels are therefore highly illiquid. This means that you may find it difficult to sell your panels if you no longer wish to hold them.
